item.title: old john's luncheonette
item.description: thoughts pies looked bomb typical diner

item.title: clinton st. baking company
item.description: thoughts put our name in at 10:30 on saturday, 2 hour wait, sat down 12:45 worth the wait menu highlights chicken & waffles milkshake

item.title: nan xiang xiao long bao
item.description: locations east village midtown williamsburg flushing - the og thoughts easy, delicious menu highlights soup dumplings

item.title: mission ceviche
item.description: locations upper east side union square thoughts “8/10, too nice inside” - travis clarke (the ceviche king himself) menu highlights red snapper

item.title: salma
item.description: thoughts byob menu highlights v good hummus

item.title: l'industrie
item.description: locations williamsburg west village thoughts chaotic in there, get in, get out whole pizzas to-go, elite move menu highlights soft serve is gas

item.title: ma • dé
item.description: thoughts seasonal veggies & fish

item.title: francie
item.description: thoughts worth it menu highlights duck pasta

item.title: cozy royale
item.description: thoughts if i was a local i’d come here a lot menu highlights burger

item.description: thoughts cecchi’s older sister menu highlights burger

item.title: this bowl
item.description: thoughts line moves quick

item.title: carnitas ramirez
item.description: thoughts goat

item.title: llama inn
item.description: thoughts easy to get a res menu highlights snow peas lamb sausage

item.title: keens steakhouse
item.description: thoughts understand the hype

item.title: lucia alimentari
item.description: thoughts bop easy repeat menu highlights little gem caesar vodka pizza

item.title: kanyakumari
item.description: thoughts fantastic menu highlights from mumbai - samrat vada pav

item.title: taverna kyclades
item.description: thoughts decor is copy paste from greece

item.title: tucci
item.description: thoughts cool basement bar menu highlights crispy artichokes chicken parm

item.title: 19 cleveland
item.description: thoughts not bad

item.title: the taco stand
item.description: thoughts don’t let anyone talk you out of getting guac (@ miguel) menu highlights al pastor

item.title: penny
item.description: thoughts delightful menu highlights wine list goes crazy

item.title: bangkok supper club
item.description: thoughts open kitchen unique cocktails menu highlights hokkaido scallop ceviche pork jowl bangkok gai yang

item.title: panzón
item.description: thoughts back garden makes a mean margartia

item.title: cafe camellia
item.description: thoughts heavy on the fried food, but no regrets menu highlights fried green tomatoes crab claws red beans & rice

item.title: dudley's
item.description: thoughts easy week day brunch/lunch

item.title: altro paradiso
item.description: thoughts underrated, top 5 outdoor seating on a nice day, woww menu highlights chicken milanese pesto & ramp pasta (likely seasonal) fennel & arancini were also bops

item.title: elnico
item.description: thoughts pleasantly colorful, but the neon bathroom lights are an actual hellscape

item.title: café chelsea
item.description: thoughts tables better suited for 2 or 4 post dinner lobby bar menu highlights spaghetti au citron meyer (lemon pasta) panisse (chickpea fries)

item.title: conwell coffee hall
item.description: thoughts converted old bank into coffee shop & full bar (tragically closes @ 9pm) order drinks from the “bank teller” also serves food

item.title: tartine
item.description: thoughts sit outside + bottle of wine + people watch andy cohen sighting menu highlights tuna tartare

item.title: the commodore ii
item.description: thoughts if i lived closer would be a local haunt menu highlights comfort food is king (entire menu is fire)

item.title: paros
item.description: thoughts lot of suits menu highlights dessert

item.title: ayat
item.description: new york locations east village bayridge industry city staten island thoughts underrated menu highlights maklouba mansaf

item.title: s&p lunch
item.description: thoughts worth wait in line 1-2 people perfect #, might wait longer for 3-4 menu highlights tuna melt pastrami

item.title: tokyo record bar
item.description: thoughts food is nothng fancy, but fun dining experience i chose “fantasy” by mariah carey :) bar upstairs is p cool

item.title: cervo's
item.description: thoughts everything is good, not a single miss

item.title: noble rot
item.description: locations lamb’s conduit soho mayfair thoughts amazing wine list cozy menu highlights gnocchi

item.title: lord's
item.description: thoughts sit at bar not for picky eaters menu highlights tiny martini pig’s head duck pie oysters

item.title: cecchi's
item.description: thoughts when dinner is the night out want to take anyone and everyone i know here menu highlights pork chop cheesecake

item.title: apollo bagels
item.description: thoughts sourdough (not new york style) avoid weekends, line is too long (hour+) menu highlights small, fixed menu honestly plain bagel with butter and jam goes crazy

item.title: bad hombre
item.description: thoughts took a long time to make our drinks, but brought us a free dessert menu highlights aguachille skirt steak

item.title: b&h dairy
item.description: thoughts different deal every day of the week menu highlights tuna melt

item.title: hooked
item.description: thoughts very fun concept, they bring out the available fish and you get to choose. they course it out for you (poke, sashimi, cooked, etc) all with the same fish

item.title: hen house nyc
item.description: thoughts lebanese shawarma menu highlights piri piri fried chicken sando if “fully loaded” is presented as an option, do it

item.title: sappe
item.description: thoughts they have semi private room for party of 8, super cozy staff were so kind and patient with my large group pre-fixe $80 for more than 8 people menu highlights online cocktail menu krapow moo grob ribs (rack)

item.title: pinch chinese
item.description: thoughts highlight for me was actually the wine list ? brought out sparkler for my friend’s birthday menu highlights spicy wontons brussel sprouts

item.title: tatiana by kwame onwuachi
item.description: thoughts walk into lincoln center, it’s on the right menu highlights everything we ate was insanely good my two favorites were the egusi dumplings & the short rib pastrami suya

item.title: málà project
item.description: 4 locations thoughts yummy menu highlights dry pot (spicy) eggplant app is fire

item.title: the nines
item.description: thoughts acme downstairs, opens 10:30 max table holds 6 people

item.title: veeray da dhaba
item.description: menu highlights veeray di gobhi

item.title: golden diner
item.description: thoughts walk-in only on weekends (waits can range anywhere from 1-4 hours lol) go during week when they accept resys menu highlights pancake tuna melt

item.title: revelie luncheonette
item.description: thoughts would go just to hang with eric again walk-in only menu highlights green chile cheeseburger chopped cheese egg sandwich

item.title: domo domo
item.description: thoughts when the sushi craving hits and needs to be resolved asap but there’s cheaper + better omakase

item.title: konbon
item.description: thoughts fantastic menu highlights scallop carpaccio mazemen (not spicy) corn dessert is so realistic i looked at the table next to us trying to cut theirs in half and thought to myself “who the fuck cuts corn like that”

item.title: the waverly inn
item.description: thoughts can walk in no problem for late dinner

item.title: raoul's
item.description: thoughts immaculate vibes fortune teller upstairs ($50 cash only) they hold 8 bar seats for walk-ins menu highlights steak frites - loaded with peppercorns, fantastic brussel sprouts

item.title: figure eight
item.description: menu highlights long beans sun chokes corn jalepeño bolobao

item.title: golden swan
item.description: thoughts old converted town house, multiple levels, full shower in one of the bathrooms, very cool bar on first floor is also great for a date rented out the entire top floor for work dinner, fanastic menu highlights sticky toffee pudding

item.title: fish cheeks
item.description: menu highlights coconut crab curry branzino

item.title: felix
item.description: thoughts res was at 1:00pm, didn’t leave until 6:30 chaotic, lit, dancing on tables menu highlights go for the magnum bottles

item.title: cathédrale
item.description: thoughts space is beautfiul, so much fun for birthday dinner menu highlights octopus, tomatoes

item.title: kolachi
item.description: menu highlights get 2 (chicken > beef) do not skip the diesel fries (spicy)

item.title: bakerie
item.description: menu highlights sandwiches looked gas

item.title: taqueria ramirez
item.description: thoughts there will be a line because it is that good menu highlights can’t go wrong, but al pastor was my favorite

item.title: tonchin
item.description: menu highlights known for their “pizza” ramen, i had to try it. it did taste like a pizza, but next time im just going to get the classic spicy tonkotsu

item.title: radio bakery
item.description: thoughts get there early, they sell out of a lot of the good stuff menu highlights changes all the time, but impossible to go wrong pie

item.title: la palapa
item.description: thoughts sneaky huge space, can handle multiple parties of 10+

item.title: c as in charlie
item.description: menu highlights popcorn chicken doodle dessert so fun

item.title: essex taqueria
item.description: thoughts hangover recovery

item.title: gallow green
item.description: thoughts restaurant on the roof of the mccitrick hotel, where they do sleep no more(a live reenactment of shakespeare’s macbeth) very interesting vibe, staff are sometimes also actors in the show, quirky vibes summer only, no outdoor heaters so if it’s cold dress warm

item.title: jazba
item.description: thoughts liberal with the butter and i’m not mad menu highlights basket chaat

item.title: hometown bar-b-que
item.description: thoughts head over to steve’s authentic key lime pie after menu highlights lamb bahn mi was the best sandwich i’ve ever had

item.title: kolkata chai
item.description: thoughts hands down best chai i’ve ever had second location in nolita

item.title: motel no tell
item.description: menu highlets fries were low-key gas milkshake

item.title: laser wolf
item.description: thoughts bar seating is first come first serve and they have a lot of seats menu highlights i’m hesitant to put anything here because everything was a hit. there were no misses, so you can’t go wrong. tuna shishlik

item.title: spice brothers
item.description: thoughts fam who runs is so cute menu highlights shawarma west (pita)

item.title: rynn
item.description: thoughts wonderful new neighborhood spot in the east village menu highlights mango lemonade is an absolute slay. pairs perfectly with the spicy items on the menu tum strawberry

item.title: ensenada
item.description: thoughts closest any place has come to rival contramar. turns into a bar - black flamingo is inside in the basement menu highlights tostada de atun - classic. can’t miss. aguachile negro - seriously spicy, but my favorite dish of whole meal. pescado del dia “al pastor” - riff on contramar’s two-color butterfly fish. al pastor is my favorite, so i loved this. jaiba suave - soft shell crab, sits on top a green chorizo & beans. one of the best flavor combinations i’ve ever had.

item.title: darjeeling express
item.description: thoughts truly amazing a la carte for lunch, tasting for dinner

item.title: bao
item.description: locations soho marylebone borough king’s cross shoreditch battersea

item.title: dishoom
item.description: london locations carneby covent garden king’s cross kensington shoreditch canary wharf battersea edinburgh location edinburgh thoughts top contender for last meal

item.title: l'antica pizzeria da michele
item.description: menu highlights arancini

item.title: hudson clearwater
item.description: thoughts private dining room downstairs, great for birthday dinner

item.title: el pinguino
item.description: thoughts fully converted me to a tin fish stan menu highlights curry tuna mini hotdogs

item.title: principe
item.description: thoughts great bar scene, asked for an americano and i didn’t have to explain not the coffee menu highlights key lime pie ice cream sandwich

item.title: office of mr. moto
item.description: thoughts dining experience, highly recommend the pairing as well post dinner drinks in the downstairs bar was a major highlight books out month in advance - need to be ready when resys drop @ 10 am on the first of the month

item.title: ella funt
item.description: thoughts also cool bar scene menu highlights chicken

item.title: thirteen water
item.description: thoughts excellent

item.title: dhamaka
item.description: thoughts to answer your question - “is it worth the hype?” - yes. be prepared for amazing smells to hit you like a truck every time you walk into essex market menu highlights ragda pattice - this was my favorite dish
menu highlights popcorn chicken black pepper beef

item.title: au cheval
item.description: thoughts brought my dad here when i couldn’t do another steakhouse. he loved it. basement bar menu highlights the burger, duh

item.title: casino
item.description: thoughts there’s a cool bar in the basement menu highlights crispy baby artichokes nduja bread

item.title: librae bakery
item.description: thoughts line does not move quick, but it’s worth it menu highlights everything is good, but my go to is the labneh & za’atar bun

item.title: cafe mogador
item.description: east village williamsburg thoughts east village classic menu highlights amba (side sauce)

item.title: singlish
item.description: thoughts bar tender was so nice and lovely to chat with :) space is tiny so def need resy menu highlights they’ve got some really nice whiskey

item.title: jac's on bond
item.description: thoughts make a res if you can, weeknights better than weekends imo everyone in there is cool and attractive and they know it

item.title: dame
item.description: thoughts top contender for best meal of 2023 menu highlights everything is good, can’t miss the fish n chips though such a good wine list

item.title: traif
item.description: thoughts hidden gem menu highlights chef’s selection tasting menu is gas

item.title: superiority burger
item.description: thoughts walk-in only. get here just before it opens for an early dinner. bar in the back - serves pints of ice cream and burgers late nite do not skip dessert menu highlights can’t go wrong

item.title: los mariscos
item.description: thoughts sidewalk entrance, avoids crowd inside chelsea market menu highlights michelada

item.title: 7th street burger
item.description: locations 16 locations east village is og thoughts first stop when i come home from a trip

item.title: madeline's martini
item.description: thoughts great date spot menu highlights french martini

item.title: seoul salon
item.description: thoughts walk-in bar seating menu highlights pancake fried chicken

item.title: foxface
item.description: thoughts been going to foxface since their sandwich shop window days - always got to try something fun and interesting first time i ever had rabbit was on a sandwich from here. their restaurant is no different, delicious & unique menu highlights try something you’ve never heard of before, you’ll probably love it

item.title: superbueno
item.description: thoughts could feel the tension leaving my body. menu highlights vodka y soda

item.title: silver apricot
item.description: menu highlights scallion puffs

item.title: rosella
item.description: thoughts tough reservation, but saw several people walk in right when it opened, so great for walk-in early dinner menu highlights dragonfly house salad we also got something with apples that was insance, but i think that dish might be seasonal

item.title: shoo shoo
item.description: thoughts elite people watching with sidewalk two tops

item.title: hilot
item.description: thoughts great date spot bar tender asked for our flavor profile so he could make us something off menu. i told him i liked tequila and ginger, got a riff on a mule that was one of the best cocktails i’ve ever had!

item.title: jiang's kitchen
item.description: thoughts halal - uyghur chinese restaurant northwestern chinese food (xinjiang region) menu highlights fried noodle w/ spicy minced beef hot and sour cucumber

item.title: gazab
item.description: thoughts criminally underrated usually have resys available at the last minute menu highlights tandoori pineapple bokchoy chaat

item.title: ariari
item.description: thoughts inspired by the port city of busan korean comfort food that’s seafood heavy menu highlights yook-hoe - beef tartare fried softshell crab

item.title: from lucie
item.description: menu highlights i think about their chocolate cake once a week

item.title: emmett's on grove
item.description: thoughts super thin crust pizza is delicious and 6 “slices” feels like 1 normal slice of pizza, so your group can order multiple pizzas and not live in fear of leftovers or over-ordering i saw two birthday dinners during my 2 hour dining experience and they bring out sparklers! they have a couple big tables, but the best is the giant circular booth in the back left corner. you can fit 10 friends and get to talk to everyone! menu highlights key lime pie was so good it brought tears to my eyes.

item.title: yellow rose
item.description: thoughts the tacos are delicious, but the apps are the real star of the show menu highlights lonestar beer queso is a must sheet cake

item.title: foul witch
item.description: thoughts rip to the fire and ice. you will be missed. menu highlights veal tortellini sorana beans

item.title: sonnyboy
item.description: menu highlights table pancakes

item.title: left bank
item.description: thoughts easy last minute brunch won’t knock your socks off

item.title: omar's kitchen & rum bar
item.description: thoughts literally everything is good

item.title: nonna dora's
item.description: thoughts in a city with an italian restaurant on every block, this place soars above the average food was amazing and the staff were so so kind! menu highlights meatballs they have a negroni menu

item.title: holiday bar
item.description: thoughts interesting concept, menu pulls all the best dishes the owners have had while on “holiday” - i.e. tuna tostada is clearly from contramar, cdmx (but not as good, duh)

item.title: cote
item.description: thoughts also has a cool bar scene

item.title: bobo
item.description: thoughts bar downstairs also cute for drinks or a date

item.title: sawada
item.description: thoughts shares space with au cheval (confusing) og alyssa introduced in chicago, hype when they opened ny location menu highlights my favorite matcha

item.title: veniero's
item.description: thoughts if you walk straight through to the back you can sit down and order dessert with table service!

item.title: sushi by m
item.description: thoughts $69 omakase is bangin

item.title: cheli
item.description: menu highlights smoked fish

item.title: buvette
item.description: thoughts where day drinking espresso martinis is acceptable

item.title: sweet chick
item.description: union square lower east side williamsburg prospect heights thoughts has chicken and waffles ever not slapped

item.title: c&b
item.description: menu highlights good sandwiches

item.title: la cabra
item.description: east village soho menu highlights known for their cardamom bun, but it was too strong for me

item.title: el quijote
item.description: thoughts they have a basement wine cellar you can rent out for a special event or birthday dinner! such a cool space. old and historic, but also trendy and cool. bar scene is cozy. also can easily walk through the double doors at the back of the restaurant and head into the lobby bar at hotel chelsea for a post-dinner drink.

item.title: malaparte
item.description: menu highlights tiramisu excellent

item.title: mino brasserie
item.description: thoughts came here with a party of 8 menu highlights steak sandwich

item.title: kings co imperial
item.description: see locations thoughts great patio action in williamsburg location menu highlights egg rolls were gas

item.title: xing fu tang
item.description: 3 locations thoughts best boba i’ve ever had

item.title: kiki's
item.description: thoughts walk-in only. the restaurant is low-key huge so i’ve never had to wait a long time. also there’s so many cool bars close by for you to go grab a drink while you wait. menu highlights maroulosalata salad zucchini chips grilled octopus mixed grill

item.title: rowdy rooster
item.description: thoughts unbelievably good. drooling just thinking about it. menu highlights obviously the chicken sandwich cauliflower is gas mango lassi is also really good (and helps with the spice if you struggle with the heat)

item.title: swan room
item.description: thoughts vibes are immaculate. the space is an old converted bank. the ceilings are high and ornate. feels like you’re in a james bond movie.

item.title: 11 tigers
item.description: thoughts chaotic but wasn’t mad about it, fit the vibe

item.title: the ten bells
item.description: thoughts sneaky huge space in the back for private events or large partiest

item.title: los mariscos
item.description: thoughts when the fish tacos craving hits

item.title: mel's
item.description: thoughts great spot to come with a big group or a birthday dinner. menu highlights “the oil” side sauce the ice cream sundaes are gas

item.title: szechuan mountain house
item.description: thoughts this was the first time i has proper szechuan food. i thought i was having an allergic reaction because of the sensations the peppercorns created in my mouth. so don’t fret! it’s just that good. menu highlights swing pork belly la-zi chicken sauteed chinese long beans w. eggplant

item.title: lobby bar hotel chelsea
item.description: thoughts i plan my friend’s visits around going to this bar - always hits. menu highlights ordering the martini is hysterical. they bring out an empty martini glass, a bottle of gin or vodka frozen in a block of ice, fill it to the rim, and give you the vermouth and garnishes on the side.

item.title: shukette
item.description: thoughts one of my all time favorite restaurants in new york. menu highlights get all the breads and dips

item.title: le dive
item.description: thoughts the best place to sit outside on a nice day. tables spill into dimes square - outdoor seating + cobblestones feels very european. basement bar where you can dance late nite !

item.title: don peppe
item.description: thoughts go on your way to jfk cash only (**wink)

item.title: ruby's cafe
item.description: 4 locations thoughts when you’re craving a healthy bowl that’s not sweetgreen or cava

item.title: miss lily's
item.description: thoughts dinner is underrated

item.title: wolfgang's
item.description: thoughts four locations in midtown, one in tribeca

item.title: mono + mono
item.description: thoughts also a going out spot - come for a late dinner and stay! dj spins late night. beautiful on the inside. plants everywhere, behing the bar is filled with fermenting jars of soju, walls are covered in records. menu highlights fried chicken is gas

item.title: taquería orinoco
item.description: locations 4 locations

item.title: contramar
item.description: thoughts invented the tuna tostada. menu highlights tuna tostada soft shell crab butterfly fish do not skip dessert !!!

item.title: licorería limantour
item.description: thoughts the expat bar

item.title: thompson italian
item.description: locations 2 locations

item.title: bobwhite counter
item.description: thoughts iconic menu highlights everything chicken caesar if you’re trying to be “healthy” but bffr if that’s your thought process. this is fried chicken.

item.title: jeju noodle bar
item.description: thoughts i think they do they a good restaurant week deal. menu highlights obviously the wagu

item.title: attaboy
item.description: thoughts walk-in only wait for your table at the bar at double chicken please, you might never get a text but then at least you’re at a cool spot no menu, just tell them what you like

item.title: sidney's five
item.description: thoughts just good vibes all around. menu highlights corn dogs lol

item.title: double chicken please
item.description: thoughts cocktails on tap

item.title: lhasa
item.description: thoughts underrated. gem of the east village. menu highlights momo (tibetan dumplings)

item.title: 12 chairs cafe
item.description: thoughts the tables are extremely tight. you will be on top of each other, but vibes couldn’t be fresher. it’s always packed. brunch is lit - especially if the sun is out, the hoes will be hoeing and the brunch will be brunching. menu highlights low-key the schnitzel slaps arayes

item.title: frenchette
item.description: thoughts they have cozy booths that are great for a party of 4-6 menu highlights sourghdough pancake (only served for brunch on saturdays & sundays)

item.title: hanoi house
item.description: menu highlights braised beef bahn mi - reminded me of a french dip sandwich (but better) because you get a side of pho broth for dipping.

item.title: st. tropez
item.description: west village location soho location thoughts came here for birthday dinner waiter so so fun & brought us shots (didn’t know what a gin gimlet was though so maybe stick to wine)

item.title: thai diner
item.description: thoughts i have waited anywhere from 20 mins to 1.5 hours for a table here, but it’s deinitely worth it. better to get there early, put your name in, and grab a drink at one of the million bars in the area. i recommend mother’s ruin they have limited resys, but i think they’re more flexible for a large party of more than 7. menu highlights disco fries pea shoots mango sticky rice

item.title: rule of thirds
item.description: thoughts had my company holiday party here and it was a huge hit, also surprisingly affordable for 35 people. menu highlights duck fried chicken rice cooker pudding - not for everyone but i loved it.

item.title: chama mama
item.description: menu highlights try the georgian wine! mushrooms sleeper hit

item.title: haile
item.description: thoughts bomb ethiopian run by two sisters

item.title: freeman's
item.description: thoughts they have not one but two different back rooms to host your birthday brunch parents love this place rustic, farm house, ski lodge chic menu highlights spinach artichoke dip

item.title: san marzano
item.description: thoughts amazing pre fixe deal ($49 pp) bottomless beer, wine, sangria skews young bc it’s so cheap wine is most likely franzia pasta is delicious

item.title: court street grocers
item.description: locations thoughts excellent sandwich from someone who doesn’t love sandwiches (a tragedy i’m told) love to grab a sammy and sit in wash square park & people watch menu highlights cannot go wrong

item.title: semma
item.description: thoughts the best restaurant in new york. such a tough res, but i think bar seating might be first come first serve. they only book through resy and allow max number of 6 people per table. menu highlights can’t go wrong. you could blindly point at the menu and end up with the best meal of your life. pre-ordering the dungeness crab is so worth it.

item.title: nat's on bank
item.description: thoughts rip nat’s on bleecker

item.title: veselka
item.description: menu highlights if you’re debating between boiled or fried perogis, go with boiled.

item.title: spicy moon
item.description: thoughts so good you won’t even know it’s vegan. there’s two locations. one in the east village and one in the west village, but the ev location is my favorite. menu highlights bathe me in the spicy wontons in chili oil.

item.title: the izakaya
item.description: thoughts two locations. original is on 6th and newer is on 4th menu highlights kastu sandwich usually sells out, people line up for it

item.title: the tyger
item.description: menu highlights osyters are unreal. served with crispy shallots. miso butter escargot (if you’re feeling adventurous) some of the most fun cocktails i’ve ever had

item.title: rosie's
item.description: thoughts skews young ceviche (if it’s still on the menu)

item.title: thursday kitchen
item.description: thoughts glowing capri sun cocktails are a little corny, but still kinda fun.

item.title: tompkin's square bagels
item.description: thoughts three locations, two in EV - orginal on avenue a, second on 2nd avenue, newest location in union square avenue a location is the best absolute classic, iykyk

item.title: lola taverna
item.description: thoughts sit curbside with a glass of wine and people watch for hours food is mid, but the vibes are summer

item.title: queen of sheba
item.description: thoughts my go to spot when i lived in hell’s kitchen.

item.title: llama san
item.description: thoughts japanese + peruvian

item.title: au za'atar
item.description: menu highlights shawarma is insane, comes sitting on top a mountain of fries.

item.title: lil frankie's
item.description: thoughts crowd skews younger outdoor/curbside seating

item.title: dante
item.description: thoughts best cocktail bar in new york. menu highlights martini negroni

item.title: ippudo
item.description: thoughts two locations one in the east village and another in hell’s kitchen save some tables for walk-ins menu highlights karaka spicy bao buns & shisitos

item.title: le fournil
item.description: thoughts feels like you could be in the french countryside

item.title: fiaschetteria pistoia
item.description: thoughts wine changes all the time, they bring your choices out in a carrier, very fun post dinner espresso hits

item.title: ladybird
item.description: thoughts vegan

item.title: panna ii
item.description: thoughts where were you when the world shut down? i was at panna ii bella hadid had her birthday here there are multiple pannas, so make sure you go to the right one - it’s top right very fun, stimulating experience - would not recommend for those sensitive to lights you’re gonna feel like sardines in there

item.title: pig and khao
item.description: menu highlights brussel sprouts sleeper hit.

item.title: lil chef mama
item.description: thoughts yummy thai

item.title: cafe cluny
item.description: thoughts odds of d list celebrity sighting are high. bring your friend who’s cosplaying as an influencer while you enjoy a delicious burger. two birds one stone. menu highlights fries are excellent.

item.title: rosemarys
item.description: west village location east village location midtown location thoughts nothing special, but v reliable menu highlights restuarant week deal is always good

item.title: chercher's ethiopian
item.description: locations 3 locations

item.title: bea
item.description: thoughts very close to broadway if you’re trying to catch a show menu highlights good cocktails

item.title: john's of bleecker street
item.description: thoughts walk-in only will be surrounded by tourists, but still worth waiting it

item.title: flex mussels
item.description: menu highlights classic white wine thai

item.title: empellon al pastor
item.description: thoughts perfect for crushing margs and inhaling tacos day or nite

item.title: somtum der
item.description: thoughts this is my favorite restaurant in nyc. it’s simple comfort food that makes my heart happy. i always take visitors here and it’s my go to place for a last minute celebration meal with the roomies - so many good memories here. menu highlights larb moo por pia larb moo - not sure what they put in the dipping sauce buts it’s as addictive as ranch.

item.title: emmy squared
item.description: menu highlights this is a pizza place, but the burger is phenomenal. it’s a double stacked smash patty served on a pretzel bun with waffle fries. i’m drooling.
